US‚ÄìBangladesh Textile Deal | Impact on India 

US to allow zero-tariff textile imports from Bangladesh ‚Äî but only if they use American cotton/man-made fibre.

Implications for India:

‚Ä¢ Higher US cotton cost vs India may limit full advantage, but Bangladesh may gain slight edge in US apparel exports. 

‚Ä¢ Bangladesh currently imports ~$2.8 bn cotton from India. Cotton exporter may take a hit.

Textile stocks already corrected 15‚Äì20% from recent highs. More India-US negotiations likely.

JPM on Voda Idea

Downgrade to UW, TP Rs 9

Believe stock outperformance is overdone as IDEA still awaits bank funding to drive next leg of the capex cycle, which is crucial to arrest subs losses & move to net adds by investing in the network

First capex cycle started from 1QFY25 post the Rs180bn fund raise via FPO which resulted in IDEA being able to arrest subs losses to an extent, but it was still not able to drive positive net adds

Its target of a 3x increase in Cash Ebitda over 3 years looks aggressive as company is baking in market share gains here vs Bharti/Jio, of which we are skeptical

Believe IDEA has multiple hurdles to cross before business stabilizes in form of:

1) getting bank funding

2) going to positive subs additions

At 15x FY27E EV/Ebitda, stock seems to be baking in all +ves

-  Greenfield R-32 facility in Rajasthan  
- Proposed R-32 manufacturing plant in Bhilwara, Rajasthan qualifies for Rajasthan Investment Promotion Scheme (RIPS) 2024 subsidies.  
- Aimed at strengthening domestic refrigerant production and import substitution.  

-  Multi-year incentive package  
- Eligible for capital subsidy, investment subsidy, turnover‚Äëlinked incentives, interest subvention and employment‚Äëlinked benefits for up to 10 years from production start.  
- Specific perks: 75% SGST exemption, 100% electricity duty waiver for 7 years, 75% stamp duty exemption + 25% reimbursement, and 50% EPF/ESI reimbursement for local employees.  

-  Financial & growth impact  
- Subsidies expected to boost project returns, improve cash flows and support 30-35% revenue CAGR over next 3 years.  
- MoU signed with Rajasthan government for a future HFO plant, which will also receive similar incentives.  

Key takeaway  
Stallion‚Äôs R-32 greenfield project in Bhilwara unlocks substantial RIPS 2024 subsidies over 10 years, materially enhancing returns and cash flows while aligning with green refrigerants, import substitution and a 30-35% CAGR ambition, with the HFO plant MoU adding further multi-year expansion visibility.
